title: Trace lines
text: geom_path_trace(), geom_line_trace(), geom_step_trace() similar ggplot2::geom_path(), ggplot2::geom_line(), ggplot2::geom_step(), also include ability highlight data points interest. particularly useful working dense datasets prone overplotting. geoms accept normal ggplot2 graphical parameters modifications. fill controls color center line, color controls outline color, stroke controls outline width, similar filled shapes modified ggplot2 geoms. Additional parameters including size, alpha, linetype, linejoin, lineend linemitre also accepted.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggtrace)  p <- ggplot(   stocks,   aes(day, value, fill = name) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_line_trace(     color    = "black",     size     = 1,     stroke   = 0.5,     linetype = 1,     alpha    = 1   )

title: Trace lines
text: Like ggplot2 geoms, variables can mapped aesthetic attributes modify outline appearance.   Aesthetics can modified using ggplot2 scale_*() functions.
code: p <- ggplot(   stocks,   aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_line_trace(stroke = 1) clrs <- c(   CAC  = "#E69F00",   DAX  = "#0072B2",   FTSE = "#009E73",   SMI  = "#56B4E9" )  p +   geom_line_trace(stroke = 1) +   scale_color_manual(values = clrs)

title: Trace lines
text: “position” outline can modified trace_position parameter. can “” predicate selecting data points outline. default groups outlined. predicate passed trace_position, must evaluate TRUE FALSE within context input data.   appearance background lines can modified passing named list parameters background_params argument.   highlight names second letter “”.   Outlines can removed setting color NA.
code: p <- ggplot(   stocks,   aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position = day > 1500,     stroke         = 1   ) p +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = day < 500 | value > 4000,     stroke            = 1,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey75")   ) p +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = grepl("^[A-Z]A", name),     stroke            = 1,     background_params = list(color = NA, linetype = 2)   ) p <- ggplot(   stocks,   aes(day, value, fill = name) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = grepl("^[A-Z]A", name),     color             = NA,     background_params = list(fill = "grey75")   )

title: Trace points
text: geom_point_trace() similar ggplot2::geom_point(), also includes ability outline points interest. particularly useful working dense datasets prone overplotting. geom accepts normal ggplot2 graphical parameters modifications. fill controls color point, color controls outline color, stroke controls outline width, similar filled shapes modified ggplot2 geoms. Additional parameters including size, linetype, alpha also accepted.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggtrace)  p <- ggplot(   clusters,   aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, fill = cluster) ) +    theme_minimal()  p +   geom_point_trace(     color    = "black",     size     = 1,     linetype = 1,     alpha    = 1   )

title: Trace points
text: Like ggplot2 geoms, variables can mapped aesthetic attributes modify outline appearance.   specifying group within aes(), outlines can also added coloring continuous variable. useful visualizing points lightly colored.   Aesthetics can modified using ggplot2 scale_*() functions.
code: ggplot(   clusters,   aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, color = cluster) ) +   geom_point_trace(     fill   = "black",     stroke = 2   ) +   theme_minimal() p <- ggplot(   clusters,   aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, fill = signal, group = cluster) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_point_trace(stroke = 0.5) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = "red") p <- ggplot(   clusters,   aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, color = sample) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_point_trace(fill = "white") +   scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "#0072B2"))

title: Trace points
text: “position” outline can modified trace_position argument. can “”, “bottom”, predicate selecting points outline. default groups outlined. add single outline around points plotted, set trace_position “bottom”.   subset data points can highlighted passing predicate trace_position. must evaluate TRUE FALSE within context input data.   appearance background points can modified passing named list parameters background_params.   Outlines can removed setting color NA.
code: p <- ggplot(   clusters,   aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, fill = cluster) ) +   theme_minimal()  p +   geom_point_trace(trace_position = "bottom") p +   geom_point_trace(trace_position = signal < 0) p +   geom_point_trace(     trace_position    = signal < 0,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey85")   ) p +   geom_point_trace(     trace_position    = signal < 0,     color             = NA,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey85")   )

what: Trace and Highlight Groups of Data Points
title: Trace and Highlight Groups of Data Points
text: ggtrace provides ggplot2 geoms allow groups data points outlined highlighted emphasis. particularly useful working dense datasets prone overplotting.

title: Trace and Highlight Groups of Data Points
text: can install released version CRAN: development version GitHub:

title: Trace and Highlight Groups of Data Points
text: geom_point_trace() accepts graphical parameters normally passed ggplot2::geom_point() control appearance data points outlines. trace_position argument can used select specific sets points highlight. examples see vignette.   geom_line_trace() accepts parameters normally passed ggplot2::geom_line() following exceptions: fill controls inner line color, color controls outline color, stroke controls outline width. Like geom_point_trace(), trace_position argument can used select specific data points highlight. examples see vignette.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggtrace)  ggplot(clusters, aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, color = cluster)) +   geom_point_trace(     trace_position    = signal < 0,     fill              = "white",     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey85")   ) +   theme_minimal() ggplot(stocks, aes(day, value, color = name)) +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = day < 500 | day > 1500,     stroke            = 1,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey75")   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Key glyphs for legends — draw_key
text: geom associated function draws key geom needs displayed legend. functions called draw_key_*(), * stands name respective key glyph. key glyphs can customized individual geoms providing geom key_glyph argument.

title: Key glyphs for legends — draw_key
code: draw_key_point_trace(data, params, size)  draw_key_path_trace(data, params, size)

title: Key glyphs for legends — draw_key
text: data single row data frame containing scaled aesthetics display key params list additional parameters supplied geom. size Width height key mm.

title: Key glyphs for legends — draw_key
text: grid grob

title: Key glyphs for legends — draw_key
code: p <- ggplot2::ggplot(stocks, ggplot2::aes(day, value, color = name))  # key glyphs can be specified by their name p + ggplot2::geom_line(key_glyph = "point_trace")   # key glyphs can be specified via their drawing function p + ggplot2::geom_line(key_glyph = ggplot2::draw_key_rect)

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
text: geoms similar ggplot2::geom_path(), ggplot2::geom_line(), ggplot2::geom_step(), also include ability highlight line segments interest. geoms accept normal ggplot2 graphical parameters modifications. fill controls color center line, color controls outline color, stroke controls outline width, similar filled shapes modified ggplot2 geoms. Additional parameters including size, alpha, linetype, linejoin, lineend,  linemitre also accepted.

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
code: geom_path_trace(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   trace_position = "all",   background_params = list(color = NA),   lineend = "butt",   linejoin = "round",   linemitre = 10,   arrow = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_line_trace(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   trace_position = "all",   background_params = list(color = NA),   ... )  geom_step_trace(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   direction = "hv",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   trace_position = "all",   background_params = list(color = NA),   ... )

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. trace_position Specifies data points outline, can one : "" outline every group plotted predicate specifying data points outline. must         evaluate TRUE FALSE within context         input data. e.g. value > 100 background_params Named list specifying aesthetic parameters use background data points predicate passed trace_position, e.g. list(color = "red") lineend Line end style (round, butt, square). linejoin Line join style (round, mitre, bevel). linemitre Line mitre limit (number greater 1). arrow Arrow specification, created grid::arrow(). na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). orientation orientation layer. default (NA) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting orientation either "x" "y". See Orientation section detail. direction direction stairs: 'vh' vertical horizontal, 'hv' horizontal vertical, 'mid' step half-way adjacent x-values.

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
text: ggplot object

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
text: geom_path_trace() understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x y alpha colour fill group linetype size stroke Learn setting aesthetics vignette("ggplot2-specs").

title: Trace lines — geom_path_trace
code: # Modify line color for each group ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, fill = name) ) +   geom_line_trace() +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Modify outline color for each group ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   geom_line_trace() +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Specify outline color for each group clrs <- c(   CAC  = "#E69F00",   DAX  = "#0072B2",   FTSE = "#009E73",   SMI  = "#56B4E9" )  ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   geom_line_trace(stroke = 1) +   ggplot2::scale_color_manual(values = clrs) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Outline a subset of data points ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   geom_line_trace(trace_position = day > 1500, stroke = 1) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Modify appearance of background data points ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, color = name) ) +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = day > 1500,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey75"),     stroke            = 1   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Remove outline ggplot2::ggplot(   stocks,   ggplot2::aes(day, value, fill = name) ) +   geom_line_trace(     trace_position    = day > 1500,     background_params = list(fill = "grey75"),     color             = NA   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
text: geom similar ggplot2::geom_point(), also includes ability outline points interest. geom_point_trace() accepts normal ggplot2 graphical parameters modifications. fill controls color point, color controls outline color, stroke controls outline width, similar filled shapes modified ggplot2 geoms. Additional parameters including size, linetype, alpha also accepted.

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
code: geom_point_trace(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   trace_position = "all",   background_params = list(color = NA),   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. trace_position Specifies data points outline, can one : "" outline every group plotted "bottom" outline bottom layer data points predicate specifying data points outline. must         evaluate TRUE FALSE within context         input data. e.g. value > 100 background_params Named list specifying aesthetic parameters use background data points predicate passed trace_position, e.g. list(color = "red") na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
text: ggplot object

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
text: geom_point_trace() understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x y alpha colour fill group linetype shape size stroke Learn setting aesthetics vignette("ggplot2-specs").

title: Trace points — geom_point_trace
code: # Modify outline color for each group ggplot2::ggplot(   clusters,   ggplot2::aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, color = cluster) ) +   geom_point_trace() +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Outline a subset of points ggplot2::ggplot(   clusters,   ggplot2::aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, fill = cluster) ) +   geom_point_trace(trace_position = signal < 0 | signal > 17) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()   # Modify appearance of background points ggplot2::ggplot(   clusters,   ggplot2::aes(UMAP_1, UMAP_2, fill = cluster) ) +   geom_point_trace(     trace_position    = signal < 0 | signal > 17,     background_params = list(color = NA, fill = "grey85")   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()
